article:
I am a sales representative and I travel all over England to visit my customers. I always  _  to meet a client first in the
morning and I usually have several visits to  _  in a day.
   One cold February morning I was due to  _  a store at 9 am. I parked my car,
wrapped my scarf around me and  _  up the street towards the
shop front.
   The small lane where the store was   _  was partially blocked by two
workmen who were busy  _  the broken pavement. I braced myself for the
expected catcalls . I was up early, out in the cold, and was laughed at by two men I didn't even   _  .
   Then I stopped and remembered my own father. Both he and my grandfather had     _  much of their early careers working outside in  _  jobs before they became engineers. I remembered how hard Dad worked, in all
kinds of  _  ; how he'd come home with sunburn or frostbite . I   _  that if I was cold, then these two guys were probably freezing,
given that it looked  as though  they'd already been working for hours.
   My customer's shop wasn't   _  but I wasn't annoyed at his lateness. I
went to a coffee shop around the corner,  _  myself a hot chocolate,
and then I bought two more, with cream.
   I made my way down the lane   _  the workmen. One of them turned to with a
wide smile and  _  with a joke, "Oh love, you shouldn't have!" To his  _  ,
I passed him the plate with the two steaming hot chocolates. I  _  , "Maybe
not. But it's too cold to be working outside today."
   I got two looks of genuine    _  from the two strangers, and a
timely reminder that it is as easy to be kind as it is to prejudge , but the former is 
so much more   _  .
From this experience, I received something different: a smile, a feeling of
happiness, a sense of friendship with strangers, and the confidence to give
more.
